hints_html:
Remember that by definition

\(\displaystyle (f \circ f)(x) = f(f(x))\)
hints_latex:
Remember that by definition

$\displaystyle (f \circ f)(x) = f(f(x))$
hints_raw:
Remember that by definition

<math>\displaystyle (f \circ f)(x) = f(f(x))</math>
question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
We simply substitute:

\[\begin{aligned} g(x) &= (f\circ f)(x)\\ &= f(f(x))\\ &= f(\sqrt{x}-1)\\ g(x)&= \sqrt{\sqrt{x}-1}-1.\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
We simply substitute:

\begin{align*}
g(x) &= (f\circ f)(x)\\
&= f(f(x))\\
&= f(\sqrt{x}-1)\\
g(x)&= \sqrt{\sqrt{x}-1}-1.
\end{align*}
sols_raw:
We simply substitute:

<math>\begin{align}
g(x) &= (f\circ f)(x)\\
&= f(f(x))\\
&= f(\sqrt{x}-1)\\
g(x)&= \sqrt{\sqrt{x}-1}-1.\end{align}</math>
statement_html: Let \(f(x)=\sqrt{x}-1\) and \(g(x)=(f\circ f)(x)\). Find a formula for \(g(x)\) in terms of \(x\) (in other words, your formula should not use the symbol â€œ\(f\)â€).
statement_latex:
Let $f(x)=\sqrt{x}-1$ and $g(x)=(f\circ f)(x)$. Find a formula for
$g(x)$ in terms of $x$ (in other words, your formula should not use the
symbol â$f$â).
statement_raw: Let <math>f(x)=\sqrt{x}-1</math> and <math>g(x)=(f\circ f)(x)</math>. Find a formula for <math>g(x)</math> in terms of <math>x</math> (in other words, your formula should not use the symbol “<math>f</math>”).
